sentence.text: On these bases, we investigated whether the ligation of ERβ by a selective agonist, the 2,3-bis(4-hydroxyphenyl)-propionitrile (DPN), could negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II HL tumor growth.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: In nonobese diabetic/severe combined immunodeficient (NOD/SCID) epidermis development engrafted with HL cells, ERβ activation by DPN was able to reduce lymphoma growth up to 60% and this associated with the induction of tumor cell autophagy.

After ERβ activation, both regulation of autophagy and protein 1 light chain 3 (LC3), a key actor in the autophagosome formation, strictly interacted each other and localized at mitochondrial level.Altogether these results suggest that targeting ERβ with selective agonists might affect HL cell proliferation and tumor growth via a mechanism that brings into play DRAM2-dependent autophagic cascade
